children.value: OpenSumi has built-in some basic components, which can be imported and used through the
module when the browser-side plug-in is running.

├── Badge
├── Button
├── Checkbox
├── Dialog
├── Icon
├── Input
├── Message
├── Notification
├── Overlay
├── Popover
├── RecycleList
├── BasicRecycleTree
├── Scrollbars
├── Select
├── Tabs
├── Tooltip
You can also continue to use the popular
component library in the community in OpenSumi, and you only need to import the theme package we provide to use it normally.
- AntD theme package based on OpenSumi
其他主题库适配期待社区的贡献。

For developers who do not meet the above schemes, or expect to write their own CSS styles to adapt to the theme, you can refer to the Token table below to use the corresponding CSS Token, such as Token is
Most custom tokens are usually backward compatible with
of VS Code, and you can also use these tokens directly.

If you feel that the definition of this part of the color value table cannot meet your needs, on the one hand, you can consider providing a PR for OpenSumi to expand it, on the other hand, you can also bypass this part of the limitation by processing it on the integration side To solve, two common methods are introduced below:
Customize through the scope of ClassName, such as:

It should be noted here that it is necessary to ensure that the
method is called before the application starts, and it is recommended to introduce it in the

When writing extensions, we will inevitably use floating windows to allow users to perform secondary interactions. When writing such codes on the OpenSumi Browser side, since the overall solution adopts a sandbox isolation mechanism, the Browser layer in the extension cannot get the top
, so when using components with floating properties such as
in some libraries, you need to re-bind a rendering container for such components.
component in AntD as an example, you need to pass in the rendering container of the current component when using it, otherwise the corresponding component will not work properly.
